item.description: Contained - Brush Fire; INC#1311; 07:18PM; 15700 W Burbank Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3aPmUFx; #SepulvedaBasin; Thanks to precise water drops from a pair of quickly arriving LAFD helicopters, forward progress of the fire/s has been stopped in just 50 minutes. The 40 ground-based LAFD firefighters are finalizing control of the perimeter of the blaze with hand tools and hose lines. No final acreage estimate is available. No injury. No structures damaged. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 88; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC10 BC14 E100 E109 E239 E288 E290 E81 E88 E90 E99 EM14 H1 H2 HA1 HA2 RA83 T39 T88 T90 WT88; CH5; 17; Brian Humphrey

Brush Fire; INC#1311; 06:28PM; 15700 W Burbank Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3aPmUFx; #SepulvedaBasin; PRELIM: LAFD ground and air response to several spot fires in volatile light-to-medium density brush south of Burbank Boulevard. No road closure. No structure threat. No evacuation.; FS 88; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC10 BC14 E100 E109 E239 E288 E290 E81 E88 E90 E99 EM14 H1 H2 HA1 HA2 RA83 T39 T88 T90 WT88; CH5; 17; Brian Humphrey

Traffic Collision; INC#1158; 04:47PM; 13750 W Roscoe Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3zy7qCK; #PanoramaCity; PRELIM: Pickup Truck towing a concrete pumping trailer entered a gas station, striking three vehicles, knocking over one fuel pump and causing 11 persons (6 adults / 5 children) to sustain minor injuries. No fire. No entrapment. Minor fuel spill on premises only. Four of the patients have declined offered ambulance transportation. The remaining seven ( unknown age / gender / affiliation ) will be taken to area hospitals for further evaluation of their non-life threatening injuries. No street or lane closures. Media Inquiries: LAPD Valley Traffic Division (Incident #3253).; FS 81; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; E290 E81 RA81 RA881 RA891 T90; CH8; Brian Humphrey

Rescue; INC#1128; 04:28PM; 566 S San Pedro St; MAP: https://bit.ly/38WmPPa; #Downtown; PRELIM: 52 year-old male is reported to have fallen from the 6th floor to a second-floor courtyard at a homeless residential services center, that has no direct elevator access. LAFD Firefighter/Paramedics are attending to the man as their colleagues prepare to use a truck-mounted aerial ladder in a crane-like fashion to lower the still viable patient to ground level and an awaiting ambulance. Unknown circumstances, patient medical condition or site affiliation. LAPD Central Division (Incident #3187).; FS 9; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 E2 E203 E205 E27 EM1 HR3 RA17 RA27 RA803 RA85 T3 T5 UR88; CH7; 13; Brian Humphrey

Complete - Rescue; INC#1085; 03:58PM; 8367 W Beverly Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3ov1jsE; #BeverlyGrove; LAFD Firefighters, including an LAFD Urban Search and Rescue team specially trained, equipped and certified to manage confined space rescues, have utilized a high-point rope system with wrist straps to quickly and safely rescue the conscious and alert adult male, who was trapped feet-first, eleven feet from the rooftop, in an approximately 18" metal ventilation shaft at a vacant two story restaurant. He claimed he had been there for as much as 24 hours. The man, who has no visible injuries, was medically evaluated by LAFD Paramedic. He declined ambulance transportation, and will be interviewed by LAPD Wilshire Division (Incident #2674) Officers to determine his affiliation if any with the site, as well as the circumstances under which he entered the ventilation shaft.; FS 61; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 5; BC18 BC5 E203 E227 E261 E288 E41 E89 EM11 EM9 HR3 RA41 RA61 RA827 RA88 T27 T3 T61 T88 UR3 UR88; CH7; 13; Brian Humphrey

Rescue; INC#1085; 03:02PM; 8367 W Beverly Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3ov1jsE; #BeverlyGrove; PRELIM: Conscious and alert adult male (unknown age / site affiliation / circumstances) trapped feet-first (an unknown distance deep) in an 18" ventilation shaft at a two story restaurant. LAFD Firefighters, including those specially trained and equipped in Urban Search and Rescue have begun efforts to safely free the man.; FS 61; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 5; BC18 BC5 E203 E227 E41 E89 EM11 HR3 RA41 RA827 RA88 T27 T3 UR3 UR88; CH7; 13; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#0231; 05:37AM; 468 N Tigertail Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3oLAdh3; #Brentwood; 42 Firefighters took 69 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish heavy flames that swept through the garage and consumed the attic, heavily damaging the 2,537 square-foot one story home, built in 1938. No injury. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 19; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; AR1 BC9 E19 E237 E269 E292 E59 E71 E88 RA19 RA837 T37 T69 T92; CH7; 13; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#0231; 04:28AM; 468 N Tigertail Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3oLAdh3; #Brentwood; PRELIM: Defensive firefighting operations on a one story home that had heavy fire in an attached garage on arrival. Fire extended into the attic, leading to structural compromise.; FS 19; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC9 E19 E237 E269 E292 E59 E71 RA19 RA837 T37 T69 T92; CH7; 13; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#1257; 06:47PM; 5967 S Figueroa St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3J3ALrM; #VermontSlauson; Address Confirmed. 52 Firefighters took just 30 minutes to access, confine and extinguish heavy fire in a vacant 50' x 200' one-story commercial building that was well involved with fire on their arrival, sparing a nearby home on 60th Street from any fire damage. No injury. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 33; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; AR1 BC1 BC11 CM20 CM22 E14 E15 E215 E233 E266 E29 E33 E66 EA1 RA246 RA846 SQ21 T15 T33 T66; CH7; 15; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#1257; 06:17PM; 5967 S Figueroa St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3J3ALrM; #VermontSlauson; *Address Tentative* PRELIM: Defensive firefighting operations on arrival at a vacant 50' x 200' one-story commercial building well involved with fire, nearby home on 60th Street threatened by flames.; FS 33; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; AR1 BC1 BC11 E14 E15 E215 E233 E266 E29 E33 E66 RA246 RA846 SQ21 T15 T33 T66; CH7; 15; Brian Humphrey
